Please explain if this is correct English sentence: 

Would you like to spend a day with me where I help you with your business and lifestyle goals?
Yes, that is a grammatically correct sentence in English.
is the word "where" used correctly here
Yes, the word "where" is used correctly in the sentence. It indicates the location or setting for spending the day together and working on business and lifestyle goals.
in this case where should refer to the day

Yes, in this context "where" refers to the day. It is used to indicate that the speaker is asking the listener if they would like to spend a specific day (with the speaker) working on their business and lifestyle goals.
